summary: An FBI tip report submitted online on November 2, 2020, by an anonymous individual in Norway alleging they were a victim of human trafficking and child sexual abuse involving Jeffrey Epstein. The tipster claims to have been sold to Epstein multiple times and names numerous Norwegian individuals as perpetrators or facilitators.

events.title: FBI Tip Submission
events.description: An anonymous individual in Stavanger, Norway, submits an online tip to the FBI alleging they are a victim of human trafficking and sexual abuse involving Jeffrey Epstein and numerous Norwegian individuals.

keyFacts: An anonymous tipster from Norway alleges they were a victim of human trafficking and child sexual abuse, claiming they were 'sold to Jeffrey Epstein several times.'

The tipster names multiple high-profile Norwegian business and political figures (e.g., Kjell Inge Røkke, Jens Stoltenberg, Jonas Gahr Støre) as being involved in the alleged abuse and trafficking scheme.
The tipster claims their own family and relatives received money for them and were among the traffickers, listing several individuals with the surname Ossletten.
The allegations include extreme claims such as forced sterilization, being put into a coma, the creation of pornography, and attempts to make the victim disabled.
The tip was submitted via the FBI's public online tip portal and assigned a formal case ID (50D-NY-3027571), indicating it entered the FBI's investigative system.
